word: Instead of claiming to be pure and holy, this honored prophet identified himself with the really sinful of Israel, as he pleaded before God in behalf of his people: "We do not present our supplications before thee for our righteousness, but for thy great mercies" (Daniel 9:18). "We have sinned, we have done wickedly" (verse 15). And "for our sins, and for the iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and thy people are become a reproach" (verse 16).
